page.title: 13PRIORSLEE HALL
page.content: Priorslee was named Priorslee because it was part of the land belonging to the priory at Wombridge. Priorslee Hall was built of red brick in the 18th century by Edward Jorden. Dutch style dormer windows were added in the mid-nineteenth century. In 1802 John Bishton, an owner of the Hall, helped found the Lilleshall Company. From 1817 the Hall was the head office of the company. During the Chartist riots in 1842 soldiers hid in the cellars in case they were needed to deal with local miners. Telford Development Corporation took over the Hall in 1964 and will be leaving there about the end of 1990. 400 people worked there when they were busiest, but 300 people work there now because jobs are being phased out. When T.D.C. leave the Hall it will be used for business purposes.
